qas.question: Under which governor was the education system unified?
Which system of measurement was standardized?
What was inaugurated in Chihuahua City on September 16, 1897?
The first large scale dam project was initiated on which river?

context: Under Governor <a0_0>Miguel Ahumada<a0_0/>, the education system in the state was unified and brought under tighter control by the state government, and the <a1_0>metric system<a1_0/> was standardized throughout the state to replace the colonial system of weights and measures. On September 16, 1897, the <a2_0>Civilian Hospital<a2_0/> of Chihuahua was inaugurated in Chihuahua City and became known among the best in the country. In 1901 the Heroes Theater (Teatro de los Héroes) opened in Chihuahua City. On August 18, 1904, Governor Terrazas was replaced by Governor Enrique C. Creel. From 1907 to 1911, the Creel administration succeeded in advancing the state's legal system, modernizing the mining industry, and raising public education standards. In 1908 the Chihuahuan State Penitentiary was built, and the construction on the first large scale dam project was initiated on the <a3_0>Chuviscar River<a3_0/>. During the same time, the streets of Chihuahua City were paved and numerous monuments were built in Chihuahua City and Ciudad Juárez.
